skillTree.localised_description: Like all Shaggoths, Kholek is invigorated by the touch of lightning, and the roar of the storm.
The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Kholek Suneater has awoken, and all the world shall tremble at his wrath!
Like all Shaggoths, Kholek is covered by a thick, spiny carapace that is impervious to almost everything.
It takes something the size and strength of a mighty Dragon Ogre to defeat and kill a Giant, and it just so happens that there is one on hand…
A titanic blow delivered by Kholek's gigantic warhammer is tantamount to the tectonic plates beneath the world shifting and colliding.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +15% for Dragon Ogres and Dragon Ogre Shaggoths
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10% for Dragon Ogres and Dragon Ogre Shaggoths
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Kholek is abroad once more, with his army of Ruined souls in tow. Beware, world!
Whenever the sky darkens with cloud and thunder rumbles on the horizon, all who know of the legend of the Suneater shiver in fear.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.
To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.

skillTree.localised_description: Khorne’s will imbues his creatures with a vicious, unslakeable hunger for battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Unnatural strength, an aura of dark menace, an unwavering devotion to the Chaos Gods – some warriors have undoubtedly been touched by the Ruinous Ones.

skillTree.localised_description: Breaking bones and ending lives, the armies of Chaos strike like an unholy hammer crashing through their enemies' ranks.

skillTree.localised_description: Doomfire is a gift from Khorne, to ensure the Hellcannons speak with extra fury.

skillTree.localised_description: The legions march forth under the Lord's inscrutable gaze, eager to kill for fear of his wrath.

skillTree.localised_description: The worthiest of Chaos' vanguard are blessed with the most elaborate mutations, which also enable them to run faster for longer.

skillTree.localised_description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

skillTree.localised_description: Impossible foresight is granted to a few among the ranks of the Ruinous armies, allowing them to land the critical blow upon their foes.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
A Lord that was once part of the tribes - one who rode the great Norscan migrations - can summon his kin.
"This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The Dark Apothecaries mix their fell unguents, ensuring those that can continue to serve.

Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The masses flock to the Lord of Chaos - a dread time will soon fall on the weaklings in the south.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The whole world will burn before I rest again."

Upkeep: -30% for Dragon Ogre units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Dragon Ogre Shaggoth units
	(Lord's army)
